ElementDescription: The NDAR Global Unique Identifier (GUID) for research subject
Subject ID how it's defined in lab/project
Date on which the interview/genetic test/sampling/imaging/biospecimen was completed. MM/DD/YYYY
Age in months at the time of the interview/test/sampling/imaging.
Notes: Age is rounded to chronological month. If the research participant is 15-days-old at time of interview, the appropriate value would be 0 months. If the participant is 16-days-old, the value would be 1 month.
M = Male; F = Female; O=Other; NR = Not reported
0= Absolutely no anxiety; 50= Moderately anxious; 100= Totally anxious

ElementDescription: Time of day the assessment was taken. Hour:minutes
On a scale of 0 to 10, how stressed do you feel?
Notes: 0= No stress at all; 10= Extreme stress and feeling completely overwhelmed

ElementDescription: On a scale of 0 to 10, how much do your stresses impact your daily life?
Notes: 0= No impact at all; 10= Widespread impact into almost all areas of your life

ElementDescription: On a scale of 0 to 10, how well do you feel that you can cope with your stress?
Notes: 0= You cannot handle or cope with your stress at all; 10= You cope with your stress perfectly and it is not problematic for you at all

ElementDescription: On a scale of 0 to 10, how problematic has your childs behaviors been this week?
Notes: 0= Child has behaved perfectly and not displayed any behavior problems; 10= Child has developed very frequently behavior problems

ElementDescription: On a scale of 0 to 10, how satisfied are you with your parenting skills?
Notes: 0= Total dissatisfaction; 10= Total and complete satisfaction

ElementDescription: On a scale of 0 to 10, how satisfied are you with your relationship with your child?
Notes: 0= Total dissatisfaction; 10= Total and complete satisfaction

ElementDescription: On a scale of 0 to 10, how much did you use your mindfulness skills this week?
Notes: 0= No use at all; 10= Very frequent, almost constant use

ElementDescription: On a scale from 1 = Not stressed at all to 100 = Extremely stressed, how anxious or stressed do you feel right now?
Notes: 0= No distress, totally relaxed; 10= Alter and awake, concentrating well; 20= Minimal anxiety/distress; 30= Mild anxiety/distress, no interference with functioning; 40= Mild-to-moderate anxiety or distress; 50= Moderate anxiety/distress, uncomfortable, but can continue to function; 60= Moderate-to-strong anxiety or distress; 70= Quite anxious/distress, interfering with functioning. Physiological signs may be present; 80= Very anxious/distressed, can''t concentrate. Physiological signs present; 90= Extremely anxious/distressed; 100= Highest anxiety/distress that you have ever felt
